decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up your mana using cards like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide, while disrupting your opponent's mana base with cards like Blood Moon and Sundering Eruption. By playing aggressive creatures like Pyrogoyf and Broadside Bombardiers, you aim to quickly overpower your opponent and finish the game before they have a chance to stabilize. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Cursed Mirror and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide additional utility and recursion options to keep up the pressure.

This combo deck utilizes Painter's Servant and Grindstone to mill the opponent's library, along with other artifacts like Goblin Welder and Urza's Saga to support the combo. The deck includes various ways to protect the combo, such as Pyroblast and Red Elemental Blast, along with disruptive elements like Ensnaring Bridge. It also includes cards like Simian Spirit Guide for fast mana acceleration. The deck aims to assemble the combo quickly and efficiently to win the game before the opponent can respond effectively.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures, such as Griselbrand and Archon of Cruelty, using cards like Entomb and Faithless Looting. The goal is to then reanimate these creatures onto the battlefield, bypassing their high mana costs and potentially overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats early in the game. The inclusion of cards like Cabal Therapy and Unmask also allows for disruption of the opponent's hand, ensuring a smoother path to victory through the combo strategy.

The deck is focused on generating a high storm count to cast massive spells like Tendrils of Agony and Empty the Warrens to finish off the opponent quickly. The key to this strategy is efficient mana generation with cards like Lion's Eye Diamond, Dark Ritual, and Lotus Petal, as well as card draw spells like Mishra's Bauble and Galvanic Relay. Ad Nauseam can also be used to draw into more combo pieces. The deck also includes protection and disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Vexing Bauble, all while maximizing the potential of Urza's Saga to tutor key pieces.

The key concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively control the board with a mix of disruptive spells and powerful creatures. By utilizing cards like Force of Will, Daze, and Fatal Push to counter or remove opponent's threats, while also deploying efficient threats like Murktide Regent, Nethergoyf, and Dragon's Rage Channeler, the deck aims to apply pressure and close out the game before the opponent can establish a strong board presence. Additionally, the deck utilizes cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistent draws and maintain momentum throughout the game.

The primary focus of this deck is to assemble key pieces of the combo involving cards like Nadu, Winged Wisdom, Quirion Ranger, and Nomads en-Kor to generate infinite mana and draw the entire deck. The deck utilizes cards like Gaea's Cradle, Green Sun's Zenith, and Chord of Calling to help find and assemble the combo pieces quickly. It also includes utility cards like Allosaurus Shepherd and Endurance for protection and disruption, as well as a win condition in Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck aims to win by overwhelming the opponent with a powerful combo finish.

The key concept of this deck is to generate mana quickly with cards like Gaea's Cradle and Llanowar Elves, while using creatures like Nomads en-Kor and Nadu, Winged Wisdom to combo off and win the game. The deck also utilizes tutors like Chord of Calling and Green Sun's Zenith to find key pieces like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Springheart Nantuko. Additionally, cards like Allosaurus Shepherd provide protection for your combo pieces, allowing you to go off without fear of disruption from your opponent.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while maintaining tempo through efficient creatures and disruptive spells. It combines aggressive plays with control elements, using cards like Fatal Push and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck prioritizes card advantage with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder, while also applying pressure with creatures like Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Overall, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and apply pressure to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Doomsday combo to win the game quickly. The key strategy is to set up a winning combination by searching for specific cards in your library using Doomsday and then drawing into them with cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Thassa's Oracle. The deck also includes disruption spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and remove any threats from the opponent. Lotus Petal and Dark Ritual are used to accelerate mana production and allow for faster combos.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly get out powerful Eldrazi creatures onto the battlefield, utilizing cards like Eye of Ugin and Eldrazi Temple to ramp up mana production. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with aggro strategies, using cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Glaring Fleshraker to disrupt their game plan. The deck also includes tools like Karakas and Wasteland to control the board and maintain tempo. Overall, the key concept is to use aggressive Eldrazi creatures to dominate the battlefield and secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on using combo pieces like Painter's Servant and Grindstone to mill the opponent's library, while also utilizing cards like Goblin Welder and Goblin Engineer to tutor for the necessary pieces. It includes disruption elements like Pyroblast and Red Elemental Blast to protect the combo. The deck also includes control elements like Ensnaring Bridge and Swords to Plowshares to prevent the opponent from stopping the combo. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo and win the game before the opponent can prevent it.
